members.leaveCircumstances: Left with infected crew members to protect the rest from disease
Died from poisoned weapons in Florian Triangle
Died from poisoned weapons in Florian Triangle

keyMoments.title: Yorki's Illness
keyMoments.description: Captain Yorki and ten crew members contract an incurable disease, threatening the entire crew.
keyMoments.significance: The beginning of the crew's tragic end and the catalyst for their separation.

keyMoments.title: Crew Splits Apart
keyMoments.description: Yorki and the infected crew members leave to protect the healthy ones, with Brook becoming acting captain.
keyMoments.significance: The crew is divided, never to reunite again. This marks the beginning of the end for the Rumbar Pirates.

keyMoments.title: Ambushed in the Florian Triangle
keyMoments.description: The remaining Rumbar Pirates are attacked by enemy pirates using poisoned weapons.
keyMoments.significance: The battle that dooms the crew, as the poisoned weapons ensure death even for survivors.

keyMoments.title: Final Performance of Bink's Sake
keyMoments.description: The crew performs and records Bink's Sake as their final act, dying one by one while singing with smiles on their faces.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most emotional moments in One Piece. The crew's final performance becomes their legacy, demonstrating the pirate spirit of facing death with joy and hope.

ships.description: The ship used by the Rumbar Pirates during their journey. It became a ghost ship after the crew's death.

jollyRoger.description: Unknown - not shown in detail in this episode

statusHistory.reason: Crew was active during their journey through the Grand Line
All crew members except Brook died from poisoned weapons in the Florian Triangle

crewGoal: To sail around the Grand Line and return to Laboon at Reverse Mountain
notableTraits: All members were skilled musicians and singers
Known for singing Bink's Sake, a traditional pirate song
Crew died smiling while performing their final song
Made a promise to the whale Laboon to return after their journey
